main event: Observation of an oval-shaped object near Huntsville, Texas on 12/10/62.
interesting points: The object was described as oval-shaped, the size of a pin's head, and as bright as a second magnitude star.
The object was observed on ground radar and crossed the area at the same time as the predicted orbit of Sputnik III.
The Project Officer concluded the object was possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature, but there was insufficient data to evaluate it.
A later sighting was reported by a crew member on a B-52 flight, who described an oval-shaped reddish object the size of a pin's head that was as bright as a second magnitude star.
The B-52 crew member was able to observe the object for about 2 seconds as it passed through the field of view.
witnesses: ground radar operators, B-52 crew member
